author: kittholland
body: Literal translation of New-TemporaryFile to C# cmdlet.

comments.author: msftclas
comments.body:
Hi __@kittholland__, I'm your friendly neighborhood Microsoft Pull Request Bot (You can call me MSBOT). Thanks for your contribution! You've already signed the contribution license agreement. Thanks!

The agreement was validated by Microsoft and real humans are currently evaluating your PR.

TTYL, MSBOT;

comments.author: powercode
comments.body: And the command to the UNIX version of the psd1 to fix the build error.

comments.author: iSazonov
JamesWTruher
comments.body: Are the tests in `test/powershell/Modules/Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility/NewTemporaryFile.Tests.ps1` sufficient, or should there be more?

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: It would be nice to test i/o on the file.

comments.author: kittholland
comments.body:
I am happy to add an additional test regarding IO but I am uncertain if testing IO after the new file was generated is within the scope of this command.

I could validate additional attributes of the resulting file, for example that the extension is tmp, that the length is 0, and that it was created during the span of testing, but I'm not certain there are any conditions that would ever cause those tests to fail.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
I believe that there is no need to examine the underlying level. We need to check only the cmdlet.
```powershell
$tmp=New-TemporaryFile
Get-Content -Path $tmp.FullName | Should Be $null
$teststring ="any test string"
$teststring | Out-File -Path $tmp.FullName
Get-Content -Path $tmp.FullName | Should Be $teststring
Remove-Item $tmp.FullName -Force
```

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: We can merge as soon as the conflicts are resolved.

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: @kittholland - can you rebase? The PR now has a bunch of commits it shouldn't.

title: Rewrite New-TemporaryFile in C# #2732
